points.name: 合う
points.desc: A suffix verb that follows the conjugated form of another verb. This verb means to do an action with another individual and requires involvement from both parties. It can be used in cooperation (助け合う “to help each other”) or in opposition (言い合う “to argue”).
points.conjugation:
Verb[Stem]＋あう
(A)＋合う (“To do (A) together/To do (A) for our benefit”)

sentences.jp: こういう時こそ、助け合うのが大切だね。
sentences.eg: At times like this, it’s important to help each other out.

sentences.jp: 二人はいつも言い合っていますね。のが大切だね。
sentences.eg: Those two are always arguing aren’t they?

sentences.jp: 隣の人と相談し合って答えを考えてください。
sentences.eg: Consult with the person beside you and think about the answer.

sentences.jp: 自分の写真を見せ合いましょう。
sentences.eg: Let’s show each other our pictures!

points.name: いくら・どんなに～ても
points.desc: An adverb that states that no matter how many times something occurs or how much of it occurs, it will not change the outcome. Though it often carries a negative connotation, it can be used for positive situations. いくら and どんなに can be used interchangeably.
points.conjugation:
いくら＋Noun＋でも
いくら＋Verb[て-Form]＋も
いくら＋な-Adjective＋でも
いくら＋Adjective[くて]＋も
いくら・どんなに(A)でも(B) (“No matter how much (A), (B)”)

sentences.jp: いくら頑張っても、彼にはかなわない。
sentences.eg: No matter how hard I try, I can’t compete with him.

sentences.jp: どんなに辛くても、泣かないよ！
sentences.eg: Don’t cry no matter how hard it is!

sentences.jp: いくらミスでも、会社は彼を首にしません。
sentences.eg: It doesn't matter how many mistakes there are, the company won’t fire him.

sentences.jp: どんなに便利でも、このソフトを使わない。
sentences.eg: No matter how convenient this software is, I’m not using it.

points.name: 一方だ
points.desc:
A noun that comes after a verb that expresses a situation that is progressing in a certain direction.
That direction can be positive, negative, or neutral, but it is a continuing direction.
points.conjugation:
Verb＋いっぽうだ
(A)いっぽうだ (“It is continuing to (A)”)

sentences.jp: 日本の物価は高くなる一方だ。
sentences.eg: The cost of living in Japan keeps rising.

sentences.jp: 全然運動していないため、体力は衰える一方だ。
sentences.eg: Since I’m not exercising at all, my physical strength is steadily declining.

sentences.jp: 残念ながらこんな事件が増える一方だ。
sentences.eg: Unfortunately, there are more and more cases like these.

sentences.jp: 高齢化が進んで、人口が減る一方だ。
sentences.eg: Because of the aging society, the population continues to decline.
